{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Amped Wireless |model=AP20000G |revision= |upc=850214003423 |ean= |asin=B008WJ6ISY |price= |est_release_date=09/15/2012 |fcc_date=09/11/2012 |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=No |manuf=Loopcomm |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=ZTT-AP20000G |ic_id=10233A-AP20000G |us_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8198 |cpu1_cspeed=620 |cpu1_cores= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |cpu2_cores= |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L6406EM2I-12G |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H5PS5162GFR-S6C |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial=yes,, (38400,8,N,1) |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8192DR |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi2_chip1_model=RTL8192CE |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips= |flags= |stock_boot=rtkload; |stock_os=Linux; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid=Amped_AP_2.4GHz,Amped_AP_5.0GHz |default_ssid_regex=^Amped_AP_2.4GHz$,,,^Amped_AP_5.0GHz$ |default_ip=192.168.80.240 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=F8:7B:8C |oui_eth=F8:7B:8C }} ''High Power Wireless-N 600mW Gigabit Dual Band Access Point''
[http://www.ampedwireless.com/products/ap20000g.html Product page] "LOO0070 REV: 1.3" is silkscreened on the board. :The board is using all '''Tocon''' capacitors. The device uses 2x [http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/SE5004L_DS.pdf '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE5004L / 5004L power amplifiers] for the 5GHz radio and 2x [http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/SE2576L_DS.pdf '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE2576L / 2576L power amplifiers] for the 2.4GHz radio. ==Device recovery== If the device has been misflashed and is unable to boot, recovery (without serial) should be manageable by switching the device into recovery mode (hold 'reset' button while connecting power until LAN ports stay solid blue). The device is then flashable via TFTP @ 192.168.1.6. Firmware would seem to be accepted in the standard '''Realtek''' format. :You will need to split the vendor's firmware into the three constituent files (using '''binwalk''' would be highly recommended).. and then likely upload in the following order.. :*the webpages bin (unk. name, don't care enough to find out now) :*root.bin :*linux.bin Additionally, the firmware of other devices sharing the same board (i.e. the [[Amped Wireless SR20000G|SR20000G]] and [[Amped Wireless R20000G|R20000G]]) appears to be easily flashable using this method (functionallity was not tested aside from noting successful boot and persistence of previous AP mode settings). See [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=663850&sid=a02fb8fbabc6417f00a2129b2cce1491#663850 ''conjur'''s post on the '''''Realtek''''' thread on the '''DD-WRT Forum'''] and, presumably, the '''RTK''' SDK code and documentation for more details.
